summary: The federal government spends more than $100 billion annually on information technology. In 2017, the Office of Management and Budget started requiring agencies to adopt a framework to improve insights into IT spending and address longstanding challenges with transparency. While costs to implement the framework continue to mount, OMB's lack of action and guidance over the last 8 years has led to substantial delays. We...
title: Technology Business Management: Critical Go or No Go Action Required on Federal Agency Adoption of IT Spending Framework
